bug.author: myungjoo
bug.summary: An ability to look up supported subplugins with gst-inspect
bug.description: Would it be possible to print-out available subplugins (tensor_filter & tensor_decoder) with gst-inspect? Or would it be possible to get such a list with get-properties?

comments.comment: : Thank you for posting issue <denchmark-link:https://github.com/nnstreamer/nnstreamer/issues/1373>#1373</denchmark-link> . The person in charge will reply soon.
: Thank you for posting issue <denchmark-link:https://github.com/nnstreamer/nnstreamer/issues/1373>#1373</denchmark-link> . The person in charge will reply soon.

PR <denchmark-link:https://github.com/nnstreamer/nnstreamer/pull/1392>#1392</denchmark-link> to get subplugins list <denchmark-code>$ gst-inspect-1.0 tensor_filter .... sub-plugins : Registrable sub-plugins list flags: readable String. Default: "custom,tensorflow,tensorflow-lite" </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-code>$ gst-inspect-1.0 tensor_decoder .... sub-plugins : Registrable sub-plugins list flags: readable String. Default: "bounding_boxes,image_labeling,direct_video" </denchmark-code>

Please detach prefix and postfixes so that it can be directly used with properties: e.g., <denchmark-code>... sub-plugins : Sub-plugins that can be registered flags: readable String. Default: "custom, tensorflow, tensorflow-lite"
</denchmark-code>
(Let's include default plugin, custom, as well)
I updated the PR to parse sub-plugin name with prefix string.
